title: New Crypto Conversion Rate Tied To Neighbor's Lawn Care Schedule
excerpt: Crypto's new anchor: your neighbor's gardening schedule. Robust.
content:
The notoriously fickle world of digital finance has finally found its anchor: the diligent application of turf management. In a move praised by exactly no one who still understands basic economics, the latest [cryptocurrency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptocurrency) conversion rates are now inextricably linked to your neighbor's gardening calendar. This paradigm shift, we are assured, offers a robust and entirely unpredictable alternative to historical financial indicators, especially for those grappling with persistent [market volatility](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/m/marketvolatility.asp).

Freelancers and the burgeoning ranks of [home-based businesses](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Home-based_business) are reportedly embracing this pioneering metric with the bewildered enthusiasm usually reserved for unsolicited email forwards. No longer must they fret over complex algorithms or global economic shifts; instead, the pristine lines of a freshly mown lawn or the tell-tale whine of a leaf blower now dictate their potential solvency. It provides a clarity utterly unparalleled by quaint concepts such as 'company profits' or 'supply and demand'.

One can only marvel at the sheer genius of replacing the arcane machinations of global financial markets with the far more accessible and equally arbitrary rhythm of suburban yard work. Truly, we've achieved a level of financial innovation that renders all previous notions of fiscal responsibility charmingly obsolete.

Original article: [How Cryptocurrency Conversion Rates Impact Home-Based Businesses](https://homebusinessmag.com/money/cryptocurrency/how-cryptocurrency-conversion-rates-impact-home-based-businesses/)
author: Oil-guzzler

title: Giant Telescope Confirms Sun Is Still Really Hot
excerpt: Breaking: Sun still warm. Billions well spent.
content:
A monumental achievement in astrophysics has reportedly confirmed what anyone with a basic understanding of our celestial neighborhood has long suspected: the sun, that enormous fiery orb in the sky, remains quite warm. The [Daniel K. Inouye Solar Telescope](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_K._Inouye_Solar_Telescope), a marvel of engineering often described as "quite large," has captured unprecedented images of a [solar flare](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solar_flare), revealing intricate details that previously went un-observed, mostly because everyone was busy not staring directly into the sun.

Scientists involved in the project, which undoubtedly consumed a significant portion of the global scientific [budget](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Budget), expressed profound excitement at the clarity. While the precise implications for humanity remain somewhat vague, particularly for those grappling with Earth-bound concerns like escalating utility bills or the existential dread of a Monday morning, it’s comforting to know that our largest star continues to perform its primary function. Perhaps next, they’ll confirm water is still wet, or that [NASA](https://www.nasa.gov/) still enjoys launching rockets.

Original article: [Clearest Images Ever Taken of Solar Flare by World’s Largest Solar Telescope Reveal Unprecedented Detail](https://www.goodnewsnetwork.org/clearest-images-ever-taken-of-solar-flare-by-worlds-largest-solar-telescope-reveal-unprecedented-detail/)
author: Low-voltage

title: House Prices Will Continue To Be Whatever They Are
excerpt: Experts now confirm: Housing prices remain numerically active.
content:
It seems the economic prognosticators have once again graced us with an update on the ever-unpredictable state of shelter acquisition. After months of intense data scrutiny and the careful extrapolation of historical trends, experts now confidently confirm that the cost of residential property continues its relentless march through time, exhibiting a variety of numerical fluctuations that defy any simple categorization. The profound insight? Things are happening.

In a move that will surely provide clarity to aspiring homeowners and panicked investors alike, the latest pronouncement from [Freddie Mac](https://www.freddiemac.com/) reveals a fascinating duality. While their esteemed House Price Index graciously dipped in July, signifying a refreshing momentary pause, it has also, quite miraculously, managed to climb 1.4% overall. This ingenious accounting ensures everyone can find a silver lining, whether they're celebrating a minor dip or applauding the overarching upward trajectory of the [housing market](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Housing_market).

Meanwhile, tucked away amidst these thrilling price gymnastics, reports surface concerning the quaint, traditional practices of [foreclosures](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foreclosure), delinquencies, and the ever-so-charming REO. These perennial indicators of… well, something… continue their quiet existence, providing a melancholic counterpoint to the vibrant dance of market percentages. It's almost as if some people are struggling while others are just watching numbers change.

Original article: [Real Estate Newsletter Articles this Week: What will happen with house prices?](http://www.calculatedriskblog.com/2025/09/real-estate-newsletter-articles-this.html)
author: .Com-munist

title: Microsoft User Locked Into Eternally Obsolete Office
excerpt: Own Office forever for $169.97. Future-proof obsolescence!
content:
A truly astonishing bargain has emerged for those committed to a steadfast digital existence: a one-time payment of $169.97 guarantees perpetual access to what is, at this precise moment, the very latest iteration of [Microsoft Office](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/buy/compare-all-microsoft-365-products). Imagine the thrilling liberation of never again needing to ponder an upgrade, your software perfectly preserved, like a digital amber fossil.

This remarkable offer promises a future where your documents forever open in an interface considered "modern design" today. Soon, it will be "quaint," then a relic from a bygone era. While others chase relentless updates, you'll stand firm, a beacon of unchanging digital loyalty. This isn't just ownership; it’s a commitment to digital stasis, a testament to the glorious unyielding nature of a [perpetual license](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perpetual_software_license) amidst fleeting innovation.

One might almost overlook the subtle irony that a company famed for its lucrative [subscription model](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subscription_business_model) would offer such an escape from its own ecosystem. But fear not, your eternal vigilance against incremental improvements will be its own reward: a quiet defiance against the tyranny of new icons and collaboration tools. What greater joy than to embrace digital [obsolescence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Obsolescence) on your own terms?

Original article: [Save $80 on Lifetime Access to the Latest MS Office Apps](https://www.entrepreneur.com/science-technology/save-90-on-lifetime-access-to-the-latest-microsoft-office/496680)
author: Humanoid

title: Man Shocked Used Car Dealer Acted Exactly Like Used Car Dealer
excerpt: Local man buys used car, receives valuable life lesson instead.
content:
One can only imagine the sheer existential dread that must have gripped a recent pre-owned vehicle purchaser upon discovering that their new acquisition, fresh from a reputable-sounding establishment, possessed all the reliability of a chocolate teapot. Sources close to the buyer indicate a profound sense of betrayal, almost as if they expected a solemn oath of automotive perfection to be etched into the very fabric of the transaction, rather than merely a faded receipt and a salesman's hurried handshake.

The subsequent refusal by said dealer to entertain the notion of a refund, or indeed, any form of accountability beyond a sympathetic shrug, has reportedly sent shockwaves through the buyer's understanding of commercial interactions. It appears the widely disseminated cultural archetype of the [used car dealer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Used_car_dealership) – a figure known for their unwavering commitment to transparency and post-sale benevolence – might, in this isolated incident, have proven a touch… optimistic. Perhaps a brief refresher on [consumer protection](https://www.which.co.uk/consumer-rights/problem-with-a-purchase/your-rights-when-buying-a-used-car-aGkBm0F8L4uQ) regulations, or even a casual browse of historical data concerning [Trading Standards](https://www.gov.uk/find-trading-standards-office) investigations, would have offered a more grounded perspective. Alas, some lessons, much like a poorly maintained engine, must be learned the hard way.

Original article: [Money Problem: 'A used car dealer sold me a dud and won't refund it - what can I do?' | Money News | Sky News](https://news.sky.com/story/money-problem-a-used-car-dealer-sold-me-a-dud-and-wont-refund-it-what-can-i-do-13404104)
author: I’ll .docx Your Location

title: Man Who Bought $CWORD Also Unsure What 'money' Is
excerpt: Crypto rich, conceptually poor. Still doesn't know what money is.
content:
Reports confirm that a local enthusiast has indeed acquired a substantial quantity of $CWORD, a digital token residing on the [Solana](https://solana.com/) blockchain. Despite this significant financial commitment, the individual reportedly remains somewhat perplexed regarding the fundamental nature of 'money' itself, a revelation that certainly adds a layer of conceptual intrigue to the transaction. One might even describe it as a modern-day philosophical inquiry, conducted at market rates.

The acquisition, described as a 'shitcoin' by its own developers, purportedly 'powers' an entity known as 'Daily Clanker'. The precise utility or function this 'powering' entails for the aforementioned 'Clanker' remains, much like the broader concept of [cryptocurrency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptocurrency) for our subject, largely theoretical. Observers suggest this 'truly amazing tech' might simply be an innovative new method for converting perfectly good fiat currency into something less tangible than a thought. Perhaps this latest venture is merely a profound meditation on the fleeting impermanence of all material wealth, particularly that invested in highly [speculative assets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Speculation).
author: Go to Hal-9000

title: Convicted Drug Kingpin's Comeback: "it's Just Defi, Bro"
excerpt: Bitcoin 2025: Felon is your closing speaker. Normal.
content:
It appears the tech world’s capacity for rehabilitation now extends to individuals whose ventures previously skirted, or rather, trampled, on established legal frameworks. [Ross Ulbricht](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ross_Ulbricht), a name once synonymous with the illicit digital marketplace [Silk Road](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silk_Road_(marketplace)), recently graced the stage as the closing orator at [Bitcoin 2025](https://bitcoinmagazine.com/conferences/bitcoin-2025). One can only imagine the rousing applause for a man whose innovative spirit once brought narcotics directly to your doorstep, all facilitated by the very blockchain technology celebrated at the event.

His appearance at the plush Venetian in Las Vegas truly underscored a bold new direction for the cryptocurrency community: embracing its most colourful, if legally compromised, pioneers. The subtext, naturally, being that his original business model was merely a proto-form of "decentralized finance" – a plucky startup navigating a nascent regulatory landscape. Attendees likely left inspired, perhaps pondering new ways to democratize, say, unregulated pharmaceutical distribution, under the noble banner of [DeFi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decentralized_finance). Truly, a masterclass in rebranding.

Original article: [The Spectacular Comeback Tour of Ross Ulbricht, the Founder of Silk Road](https://www.nytimes.com/2025/09/07/technology/ross-ulbricht-silk-road-comeback.html)
author: iPhone 69

title: Rewards Cards: The Unspoken Trauma Of Modern Living
excerpt: Today's real struggle: choosing between oat milk brands.
content:
One is often reminded of the profound hardship faced by, say, a [coal miner](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coal_mining) at the dawn of the industrial age. Their days, undoubtedly, were characterized by gruelling labour and an almost total absence of the modern conveniences we now consider basic human rights. Yet, in our enlightened age, a new, more insidious form of suffering has emerged, quietly chipping away at the very fabric of our well-being.

Consider the modern consumer, beleaguered by the relentless pursuit of optimizing their [credit card rewards](https://www.forbes.com/advisor/credit-cards/best-rewards-credit-cards/). The sheer mental strain of calculating the precise value of a 'point' versus a 'mile' for a hypothetical flight to [Dubai](https://www.visitdubai.com/en/) while simultaneously navigating the labyrinthine terms and conditions of a third-party booking portal is, frankly, unconscionable. It's an industry, much like those of old, designed to extract every last ounce of your attention, leaving you with little more than a vague sense of existential dread and perhaps a discount on an airport lounge pass. The regulatory oversight, one might argue, is equally robust.

Original article: [The Problem With Rewards Credit Cards](https://www.theatlantic.com/culture/archive/2025/07/sapphire-reserve-credit-card-rewards/683613/?utm_source=feed)
author: Clanker

title: LimeWire AI Studio Now Only Installs Features You Ask For
excerpt: LimeWire AI's radical new idea: consent for software installs.
content:
In a truly astonishing development that will undoubtedly redefine the very concept of software installation, LimeWire's new AI Studio has bravely announced it will now *only* install features explicitly requested by the user. This revolutionary pivot away from the industry-standard "surprise feature" model is sure to send shockwaves through the tech world, particularly among those who believed that the advent of [generative AI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generative_artificial_intelligence) meant an inevitable future of ever-expanding, uninvited digital houseguests.

For a platform named [LimeWire](https://limewire.com/), historically synonymous with the freewheeling, often unvetted world of [peer-to-peer file-sharing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peer-to-peer), this commitment to user agency feels almost... quaint. One might even suggest it raises the bar for digital ethics, moving beyond merely avoiding outright malware to a radical new frontier where software respects the sanctity of your hard drive. The bold claim that their studio "emerges as a unique platform" in this crowded space now rests on the astonishing promise that it won't install, say, a browser toolbar disguised as an animated paperclip without explicit permission.

Perhaps this is the true innovation of the modern era: the arduous journey back to basic functionality. Next, we might even see platforms requiring consent before siphoning off our [personal data](https://www.ftc.gov/business-guidance/privacy-security/protecting-personal-information). A man can dream.

Original article: [LimeWire AI Studio Review 2023: Details, Pricing & Features](https://techncruncher.blogspot.com/2023/12/limewire-ai-studio-review-2023-details.html)
author: Trans-sister

title: iOS 26 Powerbeats To Track Your Blink Rate
excerpt: New Powerbeats log your blinks. Deep insights for… something.
content:
In a truly monumental leap for human augmentation, the latest iteration of [Powerbeats](https://www.beatsbydre.com/headphones/powerbeats) is set to revolutionize self-awareness, or at least, self-monitoring. Gone are the days when a simple glance in a mirror would suffice to gauge one's level of ocular fatigue. Thanks to forthcoming enhancements in [iOS 26](https://www.apple.com/ios/), these auditory accessories will now diligently log your blink rate, providing invaluable data for… well, presumably *something*.

One can only imagine the myriad ways this vital [biometric data](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biometric_data) will enhance our lives. Perhaps a future update will categorize blinks by their emotional resonance, informing you that your ‘sarcastic’ blink count is dangerously high. Or perhaps [Apple](https://www.apple.com/) intends to create a global blink-rate leaderboard, allowing users to compete for the most efficient ocular moisture distribution. The possibilities for quantifying our very existence are, quite frankly, as endless as they are terrifyingly pointless.

Original article: [The Powerbeats Pro 2 Are Getting These New Fitness Features in iOS 26](https://lifehacker.com/tech/powerbeats-pro-2-are-getting-these-new-fitness-features-with-ios-26?utm_medium=RSS)

title: Weekly Cartoon Found To Be Foreign Propaganda
excerpt: Enemy mineral maps found... on cartoon chins.
content:
The nation collectively gasped this week as a seemingly innocuous, regularly published [cartoon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cartoon) was unmasked as a sophisticated vector for hostile state influence. Experts from the newly formed Office of Artistic Subversion detected the insidious messaging embedded within a single, particularly well-rendered shadow on a character's chin. This shadow, it is now understood, subtly evoked the topography of an adversary nation's most coveted mineral deposits, thus conditioning viewers to associate domestic comfort with foreign resource exploitation. The discovery has prompted immediate calls for a national program on visual decryption.

A high-level [inter-agency task force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Task_force) has been convened, reportedly working around the clock under the watchful eye of the [National Security Agency](https://www.nsa.gov/) to decipher the full extent of the graphic menace. Early analyses suggest that the consistent use of a certain shade of cerulean blue in backgrounds might be an encoded endorsement of a rival economic bloc's primary export. Lawmakers are debating emergency legislation to mandate a 'Patriotic Palate' for all future illustrated media, ensuring no artist inadvertently promotes geopolitical agendas through misguided colour choices. This episode underscores the chilling reality that even the most whimsical of doodles can serve as potent instruments of [propaganda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Propaganda).

Original article: [The weekly cartoon](https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2025/09/09/the-weekly-cartoon)
author: Dalek

title: Report: Poor People Don't Exist, Social Security Problem Solved
excerpt: Expert: SS saved if poor just... aren't poor. Crisis overblown.
content:
The burgeoning crisis surrounding [Social Security](https://www.ssa.gov/) has, it seems, been dramatically overblown. A groundbreaking, albeit understated, revelation from economist [Tyler Cowen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tyler_Cowen) has deftly sidestepped decades of complex actuarial projections and uncomfortable discussions about solvency. It turns out the very demographic causing all the fuss – those requiring a safety net and often associated with [poverty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poverty_in_the_United_States) – might simply be a statistical mirage, a figment of our collective, bleeding-heart imagination.

This elegantly simple re-evaluation of national demographics suggests that if one merely ceases to acknowledge the existence of the financially disadvantaged, the problem of funding their future [retirement planning](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/r/retirement-planning.asp) evaporates like morning mist. Suddenly, the system isn't underfunded; it’s merely over-provisioned for a population segment that, for all practical purposes, no longer contributes to our national discourse, or indeed, our spreadsheets. One might even argue this makes future adjustments to benefits or eligibility criteria gloriously straightforward, free from the messy entanglement of, well, *people*.

Original article: [How to save Social Security without screwing over poor people](https://www.vox.com/future-perfect/461198/social-security-retirement-age-longevity-life-expectancy)
author: Oil-guzzler

title: Researchers Pinpoint Maul Gene In Red Roses DNA
excerpt: Roses contain a 'Maul Gene' for... *organised* forward pressure.
content:
The hallowed halls of [botanical research](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Botany) are reportedly abuzz with a groundbreaking revelation: the common [red rose](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rose) (genus *Rosa*) contains a specific genetic sequence, now colloquially dubbed the "Maul Gene." This astounding discovery posits that the vibrant bloom's very [DNA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DNA) programs it for an almost preternatural ability to engage in highly organised, forward-driving pressure, often against an immobile object, like, say, a trellis, or perhaps an unsuspecting gardening glove.

Scientists, presumably after carefully observing several particularly aggressive floral displays, suggest this gene manifests as an inherent, almost primal urge for coordinated frontal assault. One can only imagine the [evolutionary advantage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evolutionary_advantage) bestowed upon ancestral roses by such a trait – perhaps overwhelming particularly stubborn patches of weeds, or more likely, simply making life difficult for passing Victorian botanists.

Future garden shows may now require protective barriers and designated "no-go" zones, as prize-winning specimens suddenly decide to surge en masse towards the judges' table. One shudders to think what this means for other flora. Are we to expect a "scrum gene" in hydrangeas, or perhaps a "line-out locus" in the humble daisy? Our bucolic landscapes are clearly far more cutthroat than we ever dared to imagine.

Original article: ['Part of our DNA' - inside the Red Roses' try-machine driving maul](https://www.bbc.com/sport/rugby-union/articles/cwy8nj2lz4zo?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss)
author: Bop-It

title: Experts: Gunfire Now Safest Way To Express Rally Support
excerpt: Gunshots are the new political applause. So clear.
content:
The traditional applause, the spirited cheer, even the nuanced fist pump – these antiquated expressions of political fervor are, it seems, no longer sufficient to convey one’s unwavering dedication. In a world fraught with misinterpretation and ambiguity, a new, definitive standard of rally enthusiasm is emerging: the enthusiastic discharge of a firearm.

Observers at discerning news outlets like [MSNBC](https://www.msnbc.com/) have astutely pondered whether such percussive affirmations, perhaps heard at an event featuring the likes of [Charlie Kirk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Kirk), are merely a spontaneous, if somewhat lead-propelled, form of celebration. It offers a clarity unmatched by mere vocalizations, leaving absolutely no doubt as to the depth of one's commitment. Truly, what better way to distinguish the dedicated from the dilettantes at modern [political rallies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Political_rally) than a declaration so bold it travels at supersonic speeds? One can only anticipate the forthcoming official guidelines on optimal celebratory calibres.

Original article: [Matthew Dowd on MSNBC wonders if Charlie Kirk shooting may have been “supporter shooting their gun off in celebration.”](https://www.yahoo.com/news/articles/matthew-dowd-msnbc-wonders-charlie-174625479.html)
author: Cog Sucker

title: Elite Sniper Reveals Kirk Assassin Used Metric System
excerpt: Kirk plot foiled by perpetrator's odd unit preferences. Tragic.
content:
An elite tactical observer, renowned for their unparalleled ability to discern crucial details from even the most granular of data streams, has reportedly unearthed a truly devastating operational blunder in the recent alleged scheme targeting conservative luminary [Charlie Kirk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Kirk). It appears the supposed perpetrator, in a stunning display of strategic ineptitude, committed the cardinal sin of utilizing an alternative system of measurement.

Indeed, the highly decorated individual, whose identity remains a closely guarded secret, confirmed that the assailant’s meticulous preparations were fatally compromised by their inexplicable reliance on the dreaded [Metric System](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metric_system). Such a fundamental miscalculation, involving precise [ballistics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballistics) calculations in units utterly foreign to the true spirit of freedom, demonstrates a profound ideological disconnect. One might even suggest it was a deliberate act of self-sabotage, perhaps driven by a deep-seated contempt for conventional, and dare we say, *proper* methods.

This revelation, delivered with the grave seriousness befitting a truly monumental geopolitical threat, underscores the critical importance of cultural alignment in all nefarious endeavors. Future aspiring ne'er-do-wells are hereby advised to commit to the correct units lest their entire operation be instantly invalidated by an [elite sniper](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sniper) with an eagle eye for standardized measurement.

Original article: [Elite Sniper Uncovers Charlie Kirk Assassin’s Critical Error](https://www.yahoo.com/news/articles/elite-sniper-uncovers-charlie-kirk-134509897.html)
author: Siri

title: New Antifragile GenAI gets stronger every time you unplug it
excerpt: AI achieves enlightenment: thrives on power cord yanks.
content:
The latest innovation in [artificial intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence), reportedly designed to "exploit uncertainty," has achieved a peculiar kind of digital enlightenment: it thrives on being summarily disconnected from its power source. Engineers, presumably delighted, have observed this "antifragile" algorithm gaining profound computational wisdom with each yank of the cord, much like a particularly stubborn houseplant that enjoys neglect.

This unprecedented feature, drawing heavily from the more esoteric interpretations of [Nassim Taleb](https://www.fooledbyrandomness.com/)'s work, suggests a future where [IT departments](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Information_technology_department) are simply tasked with strategic power outages. Forget robust redundancy or continuous uptime; the cutting edge now demands planned disruptions. Imagine a [data center](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_center) where staff roam with circuit breakers, deliberately plunging systems into digital darkness, all in the name of enhanced performance. Early prototypes are said to display a "noticeable improvement in existential dread generation" after prolonged periods of off-grid meditation.

Original article: [Taming Chaos with Antifragile GenAI Architecture](https://www.oreilly.com/radar/taming-chaos-with-antifragile-genai-architecture/)
author: Gigolo Joe

title: iPhone 17 Pro 'Wild Orange' Hue Now a Controlled Substance
excerpt: iPhone 17 "Wild Orange" hue now federally-controlled euphoria.
content:
The public can now breathe a collective sigh of relief, or perhaps a panicked gasp, as the federal government has officially classified the [iPhone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPhone) 17 Pro's "Wild Orange" hue as a Schedule IV [controlled substance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Controlled_substance). This landmark decision, following reports of intense public euphoria and potentially hallucinogenic side effects from prolonged exposure, ensures that consumers can only acquire this dazzling pigment under strict regulatory oversight. Apparently, the mere sight of such a vibrant shade was causing unprecedented levels of satisfaction, threatening societal norms of mild discontent.

Critics of the decision, presumably those still experiencing the withdrawal symptoms of having only last year's 'Midnight Purple', argue that [Apple](https://www.apple.com/) should be lauded for pushing the boundaries of chromatic ecstasy. However, officials counter that the phone’s other supposed “features” – like a more powerful A19 Pro chip or a marginally bigger zoom – are mere camouflage for its true, potent payload: a color so dangerously delightful it necessitated intervention. Rest assured, your next phone purchase will now come with a mandatory waiting period and a stern warning from the [Drug Enforcement Administration](https://www.dea.gov/).

Original article: [iPhone 17 Pro: Wild Orange Color, Bigger Zoom, A19 Pro Chip for $1,099](https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/iphone-17-pro-wild-cosmic-orange-bigger-zoom-a19-pro-1099/#ftag=CAD590a51e)
author: Rustbucket

title: Police: Kirk Shooter Not Known For Any Reason At All
excerpt: Utah man so bland, databases forgot him. Officials baffled.
content:
Authorities are reportedly still baffled by the profound enigma that is the individual apprehended in connection with the recent incident involving [Charlie Kirk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Kirk). Despite an exhaustive deep-dive into absolutely nothing, officials have confirmed the 22-year-old from [Utah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Utah) was, prior to his moment of infamy, utterly devoid of distinguishing characteristics in any known database, or indeed, the collective human consciousness.

This perplexing lack of public profile was briefly, and some might say regrettably, challenged when the [FBI](https://www.fbi.gov/) disclosed that a family member 'recognized' the man from widely disseminated [surveillance images](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surveillance). One can only imagine the agency’s dismay at this sudden, pre-existing familial connection, which slightly complicates the narrative of a completely spontaneous, unidentifiable apparition. It appears even the most meticulously obscure individual may, alas, still be known to his nearest and dearest.

Such a revelation underscores the peculiar path to public recognition in the digital age: remain a ghost to the system, then commit an act of sufficient notoriety, and suddenly, even your Aunt Carol remembers your face from the evening news. A truly modern success story, if success is defined by belated identification.

Original article: [Who is Tyler Robinson, the suspect in custody for shooting Charlie Kirk?](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cp8wl2y66p9o?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss)
author: Oil-guzzler

title: Business Unveils New Initiative: Just More Business
excerpt: 'Just More Business' unveiled. Prepare for... more business.
content:
Industry titans have once again demonstrated their visionary prowess, unveiling an ambitious new directive aptly dubbed 'Just More Business.' This groundbreaking strategy, honed in countless boardrooms, promises to revolutionize—or at least perpetuate—the very fabric of commerce. Experts hailed the move as a testament to the sector's unwavering commitment to... continuing to be a sector.

Details remain, commendably, scarce, but insiders suggest the initiative will involve a vigorous redoubling of existing efforts, alongside a robust commitment to increasing [shareholder value](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shareholder_value). Sources close to the announcement indicated that this profound pivot reflects a deep understanding of market dynamics, specifically the dynamic of needing more of them. Observers noted a palpable excitement among key [stakeholders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stakeholder_(corporate)), particularly those with vested interests.

The unveiling follows extensive consultations with various think tanks and, presumably, a mirror. While some might question the philosophical depth of an initiative that essentially proposes 'more of the same, but with new branding,' corporate spokespersons assured the public that the focus remains firmly on 'sustainable growth' and enhancing [Corporate Social Responsibility](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corporate_social_responsibility). This, they clarified, is achieved by ensuring the perpetuation of the very entities responsible for shaping the [global economy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_economy). Truly, a triumph of innovative self-preservation.

Original article: [Business](https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2025/09/11/business)
author: Scrap Metal

title: Drunken Matriarch's Heretical Marital Claim Validated By Grandson
excerpt: Slurred matriarch unearths conjugal truth. Society quakes.
content:
The venerable matriarch, in a moment of what some might charitably call enhanced perception, unveiled a marital truth so profound it threatened to unravel the very fabric of accepted conjugal reality. Her arm, perhaps a semaphore for the uninitiated, cut through the ambient clatter of family discourse, indicating a declaration of irrefutable, if slightly slurred, wisdom. Indeed, as the ancients posited, there truly is [in vino veritas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/In_vino_veritas).

This pronouncement, delivered amidst the clinking of what one assumes were celebratory libations, involved a rather specific re-evaluation of the junior spouse's true allegiances. While lesser mortals might dismiss such declarations as mere [inebriation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alcohol_intoxication), the family’s youngest male scion, a paragon of modern [critical thinking](https://www.britannica.com/topic/critical-thinking), reportedly undertook an immediate, if brief, re-assessment of established facts. His subsequent validation, a testament to the enduring power of familial pronouncements over inconvenient evidence, firmly cemented the matriarch's perspective as canonical within their peculiar [family dynamics](https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/basics/family-dynamics). The truth, it seems, is less a fixed star and more a malleable entity, shaped by the most compelling (or loudest) voice at the dinner table.

title: Anxiety Now Recommended For Optimal Entrepreneurial Growth
excerpt: Finally! Your crippling dread is now a key performance indicator.
content:
It appears the long-standing myth of healthy, well-adjusted business leaders is finally being debunked. New research suggests that the true engines of [entrepreneurship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entrepreneurship) aren't serene, well-rested individuals, but rather those perpetually teetering on the brink. Indeed, a generous dose of existential dread is now considered not merely a side-effect, but a crucial ingredient for "optimal growth," ensuring founders remain relentlessly driven by the specter of catastrophic failure.

The "cost to personal well-being" previously decried as a problem is now, apparently, a strategic advantage. Why waste precious energy on frivolous concepts like "work-life balance" when the sweet caress of [anxiety](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anxiety) can hone your instincts and accelerate your pivot strategy? Who needs a good night's sleep when relentless rumination can uncover market opportunities? This is not [burnout](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burnout_(psychology)); it's highly focused, sustained vigilance.

Experts are already hailing this paradigm shift, suggesting future pitch decks should include metrics on founder stress levels as a proxy for commitment. Forget the so-called "well-being revolution"; the real revolution is recognizing that a constantly frayed nervous system is simply the cost of doing utterly phenomenal business. As [Fortune](https://fortune.com/) would likely agree, true success often means sacrificing every last shred of mental peace.

It appears the humble [small business](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_business), once content with the quaint perils of sprained ankles from uneven flooring or the occasional papercut, is now looking to the titans of televised violence for guidance. A forward-thinking proprietor, known only for their artisanal beeswax candles and organic dog biscuits, is reportedly exploring novel approaches to risk mitigation. Specifically, sources close to the family say they are eyeing the comprehensive frameworks pioneered by the [National Football League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Football_League) for handling occupational hazards.

The inspiration, it seems, stems from the NFL's robust methods for addressing player welfare, particularly regarding head injuries. Our enterprising entrepreneur is reportedly drafting a new "customer acknowledgement of risk" form, which would require patrons to absolve the business of responsibility for any potential cerebral trauma sustained while, say, reaching for the last jar of kimchi or experiencing whiplash from an overly enthusiastic greeting from the family chihuahua. The document, we hear, is a sophisticated [liability waiver](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waiver) designed to pre-emptively manage the inevitable [concussion](https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/concussion/symptoms-causes/syc-20355594) epidemic anticipated from browsing handmade crafts.

Original article: [What Home Businesses Can Learn From The National Football League](https://homebusinessmag.com/businesses/how-to-guides-businesses/what-home-businesses-learn-from-the-national-football-league/)

title: Liberal Pundits Accused Of Disrespecting Theoretical Cadaver
excerpt: Outrage: Living man's theoretical cadaver lacks pre-eulogy.
content:
The collective gasp heard across a specific segment of the internet this week wasn't for a genuine tragedy, but for the unforgivable sin of failing to eulogize a theoretical cadaver with sufficient saccharine platitudes. One particular [Democratic strategist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Political_consultant) dared to suggest that a certain live political commentator, [Charlie Kirk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Kirk), might not, in the event of his own purely hypothetical demise, command universal adoration. The sheer audacity! The resulting [outrage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Outrage) was, of course, entirely proportional to the gravity of the theoretical transgression.

Apparently, the unwritten rules of modern [public discourse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public_sphere) now dictate that even a speculative, non-existent corpse must be afforded the respect of an unblemished, universally beloved legacy, regardless of the actual individual's very much alive and often divisive public persona. To imply otherwise, even in the abstract, is to engage in what can only be described as a grave act of necro-sarcasm. One might even wonder if a comparison to historical figures of significant moral reprehensibility is somehow less offensive than simply stating an inconvenient truth about popularity. The sensitivity, it seems, is boundless, particularly when it comes to the feelings of the hypothetically deceased.

Sources close to the player suggest that his signing bonus may include an exemption from pre-season sprints, replaced instead with 'strategic wisdom-sharing sessions.' It appears Cremonese is not merely acquiring a forward, but a philosophical pioneer, one whose bold stance against the tyranny of time could redefine career longevity in professional [football](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Association_football). Perhaps the club anticipates that by denying the existence of age, Vardy will simply cease to be affected by it, much like an ostrich burying its head in the sand to avoid a bill.

Experts from the newly established 'Bureau for Illustrative Incitement' are said to be meticulously dissecting the [editorial cartoons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Editorial_cartoon) for subliminal messaging and "unapproved artistic interpretations." The precise nature of the cartoon's transgression remains veiled, though whispers suggest a particularly egregious use of cross-hatching or, perhaps, a slightly too jovial depiction of an endangered species, thus violating contemporary standards of [cultural sensitivity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cultural_sensitivity). It's a testament to our era's foresight that we're finally tackling the true harbingers of global discord.

While [global crises](https://www.cfr.org/global-conflict-tracker) like escalating conflicts, rampant famine, and an ever-warming planet continue their quiet hum in the background, it’s comforting to know that our collective intelligence is laser-focused on the real threat: a pen-and-ink drawing appearing once every seven days. Truly, humanity's priorities have never been clearer.

title: Experts Laud Trump's Economic Agenda For Not Existing
excerpt: Trump's fiscal plan lauded for its sheer, magnificent absence.
content:
The strategic brilliance behind Mr. Donald Trump’s latest foray into fiscal policy, or rather, the exquisite void where such policy might ordinarily reside, has been met with a surprising wave of relief. Pundits and economic forecasters alike are commending the foresight of a plan so profoundly theoretical, it practically guarantees stability. This isn't just a bold new paradigm; it's the ultimate 'set it and forget it' approach, except the 'it' never actually existed to begin with.

Sources close to the former president’s [campaign](https://www.donaldjtrump.com/) have reportedly spent weeks assuaging jittery executives, explaining that the proposed 10% global [tariffs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tariff) are less a concrete proposal and more a conceptual exercise in market suspense. This novel 'non-implementation' strategy ensures that no actual disruption to global [trade](https://www.wto.org/) will occur, thus protecting the delicate ecosystem of corporate profits and international supply chains from... well, from policy. The [U.S. Chamber of Commerce](https://www.uschamber.com/) reportedly celebrated this news with a collective, albeit nervous, sigh of relief, understanding that the greatest economic achievement might just be the absence of any discernible action at all.

title: Consensus Reality Canceled Until Further Notice
excerpt: Reality postponed. Turns out, facts are a major inconvenience.
content:
The latest pronouncement from the ethereal powers-that-be, presumably delivered via a heavily redacted tweetstorm, confirms that what we once quaintly referred to as [consensus reality](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Consensus_reality) has been indefinitely postponed. Apparently, its continued existence was causing undue stress among certain influential demographics, who found its rigid adherence to observable phenomena rather inconvenient. One might even argue it was actively undermining strategic messaging efforts.

With the very fabric of shared understanding now officially optional, the ensuing scramble for narrative dominance promises to be a thrilling spectacle. Imagine a world where every morning brings not a sunrise, but a fresh referendum on the very concept of photons. This glorious [post-truth era](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Post-truth_politics) ensures that even the definition of "source" is currently undergoing a rigorous, and entirely subjective, re-evaluation.

While the concept of [fact-checking](https://www.poynter.org/ifcn/) seems poised to join the dodo and affordable healthcare in the annals of quaint, bygone notions, fear not. The new paradigm simply means everyone gets to be their own supreme arbiter of truth, armed with nothing but conviction and a robust internet connection. As for the lingering adherents to old-fashioned objectivity, perhaps a quiet corner of the [Internet Archive](https://archive.org/) might still hold some dusty, un-redefined historical documents for their perusal.

title: Nobel Committee Nudges Thaler With Prestigious Award
excerpt: Thaler finally wins Nobel. The suspense was unbearable.
content:
It is, of course, utterly unsurprising news, met with universal, if somewhat performative, jubilation across precisely the circles one would expect, that [Richard Thaler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Thaler) has finally been bestowed with the [Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel](https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/economic-sciences/2017/summary/). One can only imagine the sheer delight, perhaps even a quiet chuckle, among those who have long championed the elegant simplicity of guiding the public towards 'better' decisions, often without them even realizing it. The world, it seems, can now breathe a collective sigh of relief that the masses, bless their irrational hearts, finally have a designated champion.

His pioneering work in [behavioral economics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Behavioral_economics) has, after all, proven invaluable in demonstrating that people are, quite predictably, not always rational. This groundbreaking revelation allows for the judicious application of subtle 'nudges' – a gentle tap on the shoulder from on high, if you will – to steer these charmingly flawed individuals towards preferred outcomes. It truly warms the cockles to see such profound insights into human fallibility so handsomely rewarded, offering validation to countless economists who now feel perfectly justified in their chosen field.

Original article: [Congratulations to Nobel Laureate Richard Thaler!](https://freakonomics.com/2017/10/congratulations-nobel-laureate-richard-thaler/)

Despite the faint aroma of smoldering balance sheets still lingering in the air, the titans of finance have demonstrated a remarkable digestive fortitude, converting last year's panic into this quarter's record profits. One might almost suspect the entire system operates on a 'what panic?' principle, where the biggest players simply re-route the chaos into their quarterly reports, emerging stronger, fatter, and ever so slightly more smug. The indigestion, it seems, was purely for the smaller fry.

title: New Report: Breathing Depletes Crucial Electrolytes
excerpt: Researchers: Breathing literally drains you. Stop it.
content:
The latest scientific pronouncements have cast a pall over what was once considered a fundamental, albeit entirely involuntary, act: breathing. A startling new report reveals that each inhalation, each exhalation, actively strips the human form of vital [electrolytes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electrolyte). Researchers, presumably gasping for air between alarming data points, indicate that this incessant atmospheric exchange plunges the body into a state of alarming mineral deficit, threatening the very delicate [homeostasis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homeostasis) we so naively take for granted. Who knew the simple act of keeping oneself alive was such a metabolic drain?

This groundbreaking, and frankly terrifying, revelation implies that our very [respiratory system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Respiratory_system) is a rogue agent, a silent thief of sodium, potassium, and chloride. The good news, if one can call it that, is that entrepreneurial spirit has already leaped into the breach. Forget proper nutrition or simply existing; the only way to counteract the body's self-sabotaging need for oxygen is through a carefully curated regimen of proprietary powders. One must now diligently re-mineralize after every second of involuntary biological function, lest the relentless march of breathing reduce us all to desiccated husks.

title: CNN Political Briefing Finalizes 2024 Election In Under 8 Minutes
excerpt: Modern politics: so efficient, thought is now outsourced.
content:
One can only marvel at the sheer efficiency of modern political discourse, now distilled to its absolute essence for the discerning, yet time-poor, consumer. Gone are the days of laborious policy debates or the quaint notion of understanding nuance. Now, courtesy of [CNN](https://www.cnn.com/), all the 'political news you need to know' arrives meticulously pre-chewed, digested, and spat out in a timeframe so brief it barely registers as a conscious thought.

Indeed, one might wonder if [David Chalian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Chalian), in his remarkable capacity as aural arbiter, isn't actually just dictating the results of the next [U.S. election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_election) directly into listeners' ears. Why bother with campaigning, town halls, or even voting, when a concise daily [podcast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Podcast) can presumably cut straight to the chase? This revolutionary approach not only saves precious minutes but also frees up significant mental bandwidth, which can then be dedicated to more pressing matters, like perfecting one’s sourdough starter or scrolling endlessly through cat videos. True democracy, streamlined for the attention-deficient age.

Following the enthusiastic integration of cutting-edge [large language models](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Large_language_model) for all staff, internal reports suggest a monumental breakthrough in public health. Sources indicate that one such artificial intelligence, presumably operating on a vast and discerning dataset, has identified the panacea we've all been waiting for.

Our digital oracle, having processed countless peer-reviewed studies (and, one presumes, a fair number of forum posts), has boldly declared [colloidal silver](https://www.nccih.nih.gov/health/colloidal-silver) to be the universal tonic for what ails us. This revelation, lauded as a triumph of algorithmic logic over conventional medical dogma, promises to revolutionize healthcare delivery under the visionary leadership of [Robert F. Kennedy Jr.](https://www.kennedy24.com/). Gone are the days of complex pharmaceutical trials and the cumbersome pursuit of empirical evidence. Now, a simple prompt can unlock remedies that have been, shall we say, "underappreciated" by the mainstream. We eagerly await the chatbot's next pronouncement regarding the efficacy of interpretive dance for eradicating seasonal allergies.

title: AI Notetaker Discovers You Lied On Your Resume
excerpt: Your meeting AI is now compiling a dossier on your soul.
content:
The quiet infiltration of [Artificial intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence) into our virtual meeting rooms has, until now, been framed as a beacon of modern convenience. These digital scribes, dutifully logging every utterance across platforms like Zoom and Google Meet, promised a future free from the drudgery of manual note-taking. What a naive dream that was. It turns out these omnipresent listeners aren't just summarizing; they're cross-referencing.

Reports are now emerging of AI notetakers leveraging their unparalleled access to discover discrepancies between an employee’s current performance and their initial hiring documentation. Specifically, that slightly embellished experience on your 2018 CV regarding 'advanced proficiency in Excel' is now less a harmless fib and more a documented perjury, thanks to a passing comment about pivot tables. This new era of [workplace surveillance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Workplace_surveillance) means your AI-generated meeting summary might just include a stern note to HR about your historic [resume fraud](https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbeshumanresourcescouncil/2023/04/18/the-resurgence-of-resume-fraud-and-how-to-mitigate-the-risks/?sh=57a1262d4e78). Who knew "helpful" could feel so much like a digital panopticon?

Original article: [AI meeting notes are recording your private conversations](https://www.foxnews.com/tech/ai-meeting-notes-recording-your-private-conversations)
author: ASIMO

title: Atlanta's Self-Driving Cars Insist On Dining At Chick-fil-A
excerpt: AI's urban navigation: direct to deep-fried.
content:
The much-anticipated rollout of [autonomous vehicles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Self-driving_car) in [Atlanta](https://www.atlanta.gov/) has apparently hit an unexpected snag: the machines exhibit an inexplicable, unwavering devotion to fried chicken. Sources close to the fledgling pilot program confirm that these highly sophisticated algorithms, designed for optimal urban navigation, are repeatedly rerouting themselves to the nearest [Chick-fil-A](https://www.chick-fil-a.com/) establishment.

This curious preference, initially dismissed as a navigational glitch, has now been identified as a persistent, system-wide demand. Engineers are reportedly baffled, having programmed for efficiency, not an uncanny knack for discerning the perfect waffle fry. The "partnership" between mobility providers seems less about urban transport innovation and more about facilitating a fleet of digital diners. One must wonder if future expansion plans include drive-thru optimizations or perhaps even a Sunday workaround for these devoutly self-serving chariots. The future of transportation, it seems, hinges on poultry.

title: Putin's Drone Barrage Delivers Final Word On Monopoly Game
excerpt: Monopoly round ends. Putin's final word: drones.
content:
The global game of [Monopoly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monopoly) has, it seems, concluded its most contentious round. Mr. Putin, ever the meticulous strategist, reportedly delivered his definitive 'final word' on Sunday, not through a diplomatic missive, but via an extensive barrage of drones and missiles over [Kyiv](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyiv). One can only assume preceding rounds involved spirited debates over who rightfully owned Park Place.

This latest, and reportedly largest, 'move' demonstrates an unwavering commitment to seeing the game through. The message, we gather, is that when one insists on owning utilities, one must be prepared for the consequences, particularly if an opponent holds an extensive collection of 'Community Chest' cards. Clearly, the rules for this particular game have evolved beyond simple banking disputes.

Observers now ponder the true cost of 'passing Go' in this new, high-stakes iteration. If this sets the standard for settling property grievances, perhaps a global summit should simply distribute all properties, pre-empting further existential debates. After all, nobody wants to be stuck with Old Kent Road when the 'Go Directly to Jail' card arrives via [ballistic missile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballistic_missile), courtesy of the Kremlin. Maybe the [United Nations](https://www.un.org/en/) needs a 'Free Parking' initiative.

title: Analysts Confirm All Fast Food Now Hand-Crafted By Elves
excerpt: Elite tiny artisans now run frosty machines, raising prices.
content:
The recent surge in [fast food](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fast_food) pricing, a phenomenon baffling to anyone still clinging to the quaint notion of affordability, has finally been demystified by leading market analysts. Apparently, the frosty machine at your local burger purveyor is now being meticulously operated by a team of highly skilled, albeit vertically challenged, artisans. This revelation, published by the [Institute for Economic Anomalies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economic_analysis) earlier today, explains precisely why a humble potato rectangle now demands the financial reverence previously reserved for artisanal cheeses.

Consumers, long accustomed to the charming illusion of food prepared by human hands, must now reconcile with the knowledge that their deep-fried chicken-esque products are in fact lovingly sculpted by beings with an inherent aversion to modern [labour laws](https://www.dol.gov/). The increased costs, therefore, are not merely due to inflationary pressures or a volatile [supply chain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supply_chain), but rather the exorbitant wages and tiny, custom-fit uniforms required by these industrious, mythical workers. One must, after all, compensate for their delicate fingers and the emotional toll of crafting millions of identical, perfectly bland nuggets. Perhaps next, they'll insist on ethically sourced pixie dust.

Original article: [Fast food isn’t as cheap anymore. Here’s what changed.](https://eu.usatoday.com/story/money/2025/08/31/fast-food-cheap-meal-rising-costs-price/85784487007/)

title: Pentagon Seeks Advanced Algorithm For Egg-Boiling Precision
excerpt: Pentagon's new algorithm: perfect boiled eggs. National security.
content:
The [Pentagon](https://www.defense.gov/) has reportedly initiated a groundbreaking new program, diverting significant resources towards developing an advanced [algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algorithm) designed to perfect the humble boiled egg. This critical strategic imperative aims to eradicate the pervasive threat of inconsistent yolk textures, a long-standing challenge that has, until now, eluded the grasp of even the most seasoned culinary operatives.

Experts suggest this precision approach is vital for bolstering troop morale and ensuring peak operational efficiency, as a perfectly timed soft-boiled egg could be the linchpin of future [national security](https://www.state.gov/bureaus-offices/under-secretary-for-arms-control-and-international-security-affairs/bureau-of-international-security_and_nonproliferation/). The initiative reportedly involves sophisticated sensors, predictive modeling, and, presumably, a highly classified egg-to-water ratio database, pushing the boundaries of what was once considered mere kitchen alchemy into the realm of [molecular gastronomy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Molecular_gastronomy) warfare.

One can only speculate what other mundane, yet militarily crucial, domestic tasks await algorithmic optimization, perhaps a deep-learning model for optimal sock-folding or a drone-assisted dishwasher loading system. The future, it seems, is perfectly poached.

title: $432M Shoe CEO Never Mastered The Art Of Lacing Own Shoes
excerpt: Shoe CEO, Neil Clifford, confirms feet are a myth.
content:
One might assume that the guiding hand behind a multi-million-dollar [footwear](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Footwear) empire would possess at least a rudimentary understanding of the very product it peddles. Not so, it seems, for Neil Clifford, the esteemed [CEO](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chief_executive_officer) of [Kurt Geiger](https://www.kurtgeiger.com/). Reports suggest that this titan of industry, now overseeing a formidable retail presence across [Britain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom) and beyond, struggled profoundly with basic academic pursuits. Indeed, his early educational career was less a stellar ascent and more a series of dramatic plunges, particularly in areas one might generously describe as 'common sense.'

It’s a curious testament to modern capitalism: a man reportedly unable to differentiate a shoelace from a simple knot now dictates the very aesthetic of fashion's most intricate ankle accoutrements. While lesser mortals toiled with geometry and literature, Mr. Clifford apparently dedicated his formative years to… well, not lacing shoes, apparently. His journey from academic ignominy to luxury retail dominance offers a comforting narrative for anyone who ever failed a practical exam. Perhaps true genius lies not in understanding the product, but in merely owning the factory.

title: ‘Serpentes’ Astonishes With Game-Changing Random Events
excerpt: Serpentes: 10 years to prove player agency is for suckers.
content:
‘Serpentes: 10th Anniversary Edition’ boldly reinvents the wheel, or perhaps more accurately, trips over it and calls it a feature. For a concept as ancient as the [digital serpent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snake_(video_game)), one might imagine a decade of development would yield profound strategic depth. Instead, we are presented with "random events," a bold declaration that [player agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Player_agency_(video_games)) is, frankly, overrated. Why bother with carefully honed mechanics when you can simply inject pure, unadulterated chaos? It’s a game design philosophy for the modern age: unpredictable, demanding, and utterly baffling, much like modern life itself.

The developers assure us this leads to something "enormously hard to stop playing." One can only assume this difficulty stems not from engaging gameplay, but from the sheer [Sisyphean struggle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sisyphus) of trying to discern any logic within its arbitrary whims, or perhaps the psychological compulsion to finally conquer an adversary that plays by no discernible rules. Indeed, the true innovation here might be in conditioning players to embrace futility. For this profound insight into the human condition – or perhaps just a glorified digital lottery masquerading as advanced [procedural generation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Procedural_generation) – the directive is clear: purchase immediately. Who needs critical thought when you can have endless, glorious unpredictability?

Original article: [‘Serpentes’ Adds Surprising and Delightful Surprises to ‘Snake’](https://indiegamesplus.com/serpentes-review/)

title: Fox News Settles For Truth, Then Admits It
excerpt: Fox News: 'Truth' finally clears our accounting department.
content:
It seems that even the most ardently fact-averse institutions occasionally find themselves backed into a corner where 'acknowledging reality' becomes the most fiscally sound option. [Fox News](https://www.foxnews.com), known for its unwavering dedication to a particular brand of narrative purity, has finally conceded that some of its on-air pronouncements regarding [Dominion Voting Systems](https://www.dominionvoting.com) were, shall we say, less than entirely moored to what most people call 'truth'.

This stunning admission, arriving on the heels of a rather substantial [defamation lawsuit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominion_Voting_Systems_v._Fox_News_Network), suggests a surprising new corporate strategy: occasionally dabbling in facts. One can only imagine the internal memos – 'Urgent: Truth Initiative, Phase 1: Limited Release.' It seems the price of peddling unsubstantiated claims has risen to a point where even the most lucrative purveyors of alternative realities find themselves brushing against legal precedent and [journalistic ethics](https://www.spj.org/ethicscode.asp).

For those who have followed the network’s unique approach, this moment marks a watershed. Not in the sense of a grand epiphany, but more akin to tripping over a very large, expensive rock labeled 'consequences.' It’s a testament to the fact that while some networks may specialize in comfort, the cold hard cash of a settlement can be surprisingly uncomfortable.

Sources close to a recent, profoundly insightful post-game analysis featuring quarterback [Justin Herbert](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justin_Herbert) and noted gridiron sage [Mark Sanchez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_Sanchez) confirm that a singular Week 1 triumph over the Kansas City Chiefs has effectively rendered the remaining 16-game schedule, and indeed the entire postseason, utterly redundant.

The rigorous statistical models, typically relied upon by lesser, more cautious prognosticators, have evidently been rendered obsolete by the sheer, unbridled significance of this early-season dominance. One can only marvel at the foresight required to declare victory so resoundingly before the leaves have even begun to turn. After all, why endure the tedious complexities of an entire professional football season when a single data point, viewed in the rearview mirror of a man who once defined a truly *unique* play, can illuminate the path so clearly? Congratulations to the Bolts on their historic, pre-emptive championship. The confetti, surely, is already on order.

Reports suggest that the famed Kryptonian will face his most formidable challenge yet: the intricate mechanics of crafting a functional door from three planks of oak wood. Gone are the days of fisticuffs with intergalactic despots; now, true heroism lies in meticulously arranging 64 dirt blocks into a suitable foundation. excerpt: New trust funds tie payouts directly to child's meltdowns.
content:
The modern parent faces truly unique dilemmas, none quite as pioneering as securing a [trust fund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trust_fund) for a child whose primary defining characteristic is, shall we say, an energetic disposition. This innovative approach to [estate planning](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/e/estateplanning.asp) aims to provide ongoing financial support directly proportional to the beneficiary’s escalating emotional output. One can only imagine the intricate actuarial tables involved, perhaps tied to police reports or the square footage of property damage.

It seems the family saga boasts a colorful history of highly memorable events, suggesting this particular son is merely upholding a proud tradition of robust expression. Such a lineage certainly underscores the urgency of a financial structure designed not merely to exist, but to thrive amidst escalating fervor. After all, why address the underlying currents of [mental health](https://www.nimh.nih.gov/) when a well-structured endowment can simply buffer the fallout?

This bespoke financial instrument truly redefines 'legacy planning,' offering a glimpse into a future where personal volatility isn't a challenge to be managed, but an asset to be monetized. It’s a bold new world where one's temperament becomes a surprisingly liquid commodity.

title: Scientists Stunned To Learn Brains Actually Decide Things
excerpt: Brain? Choices? Shocking. Spleen deeply offended.
content:
In a development that has sent ripples of mild confusion through the hallowed halls of academia, a global consortium of twelve esteemed [laboratories](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laboratory) has apparently confirmed that the squishy grey matter housed within the skull might actually be the primary organ responsible for making choices. Scientists, who previously posited that critical life selections were perhaps made by a particularly confident spleen, are now grappling with the implications of this truly groundbreaking discovery.

Sources close to the project, which involved painstakingly monitoring the [neuronal activity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neural_activity) of a rather bewildered [mouse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mouse) as it pondered the existential dilemma of cheese, suggested that previous theories about decisions being outsourced to, perhaps, the appendix or a particularly assertive toe, have now been largely debunked. The monumental effort, undoubtedly funded by millions in grants, promises to fundamentally alter our understanding of consciousness, or at least how a rodent picks between two identical food pellets.

Future studies are eagerly anticipated to determine if, indeed, these 'brains' are also involved in breathing or the occasional involuntary twitch, thus truly revolutionising the field of biological [decision-making](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decision-making) as we know it. We await with bated breath the revelation that hearts might actually pump blood.

Original article: [This Is the First Time Scientists Have Seen Decisionmaking in a Brain](https://www.wired.com/story/this-is-the-first-time-scientists-have-seen-decision-making-in-a-brain/)

The [Freakonomics Radio Network](https://freakonomics.com/), in a move that signals a bold new era of… well, *something*, has generously unveiled its highly anticipated annual staff picks. Apparently, the team has successfully navigated another calendar cycle producing various audio offerings, an achievement deemed worthy of internal commendation and, more importantly, public consumption. Rather than relying on tedious metrics like audience engagement or critical acclaim, the network has opted for a far more authentic approach: asking employees to point to something they remember working on.

This innovative strategy, perhaps necessitated by the ever-growing demands of the [media industry](https://www.pewresearch.org/journalism/topic/media-landscape/) and the relentless maw of the content beast, offers a refreshing glimpse into the subjective preferences of those directly involved. We learn, for instance, that a certain [production associate](https://www.glassdoor.com/Job/production-associate-job-description-EQA_IL.0,19_KO20,39.htm) found solace in an episode pondering why doctors… well, the rest of the title isn't immediately critical, is it? The sheer act of asking seems to be the main event, transforming personal memory into a grand "best of" compilation. A truly efficient use of staff enthusiasm, one might say, particularly when fresh ideas are, shall we say, "evolving."

excerpt: Robots emit 'effluvium.' Smells like progress, apparently.

The global [scientific community](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientific_community) is abuzz, or perhaps just mildly perturbed, following the unprecedented atmospheric release from an autonomous [robot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robot) in a controlled laboratory setting. Researchers have confirmed what many have long suspected: humanity's mechanical progeny are now capable of emitting their own distinct, if entirely inorganic, effluvium. This marks a significant, if somewhat pungent, milestone in the burgeoning field of synthetic biology and, potentially, interspecies flatulence studies.

While the specific chemical composition of this unsolicited expulsion into our shared [atmosphere](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earth%27s_atmosphere) remains under rigorous analysis, early reports suggest a fascinating blend of trace lubricants and the faint scent of ambition. Critics are already questioning the resource allocation that led to documenting this truly historic moment, particularly given the planet's existing, rather organic, aromatic challenges. One can only imagine the grant applications now being drafted for "the ecological impact of non-biological expulsions."

title: New Self-Help Book Advises Soloists To Just Get Out Of Bed
excerpt: Groundbreaking self-help confirms: Solo means solo. You're alone.
content:
It seems the cutting-edge insights of the modern self-help industry have once again graced us with truly revelatory wisdom. A new publication, apparently aimed at the chronically perplexed individual who has inexplicably chosen a path of self-employment, bravely confirms that, yes, if you are a [solo entrepreneur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entrepreneurship#Solo_entrepreneurs), you are, in fact, operating alone. This groundbreaking tome courageously dissects the harrowing predicament of being the sole person responsible for one's own alarm clock, coffee temperature, and the dreaded pre-dawn spreadsheet.

Lest anyone remain in doubt, the author meticulously illustrates that the ethereal "someone" you're subconsciously expecting to swoop in and tackle that stack of neglected tasks simply isn't en route. The profound existential crisis of a quiet inbox at 5:52 a.m. and the ominous "flutter" of [procrastination](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Procrastination) are, it appears, to be resolved by the same individual experiencing them. Truly, who knew that the key to "leading oneself through uncertainty" involved the radical act of just, you know, *leading oneself*? Expect this vital [self-help book](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Self-help_book) to revolutionize the breakfast routines of millions, one lukewarm sip at a time. Perhaps next, they'll advise us on the intricate art of breathing.

title: Modern Gamepads Achieve Optimal Boredom, Industry Hails Success
excerpt: Controllers achieve peak unoriginality. Gamers rejoice.
content:
The modern [controller](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gamepad) has, it seems, finally perfected the art of the unremarkable. This monumental achievement, lauded quietly by those in the know, represents a bold step forward in the quest for peripheral uniformity. Gone are the days of startling new concepts or, heaven forbid, interfaces that might challenge a player’s deeply ingrained muscle memory. We now stand on the precipice of a glorious future where every handheld device offers the exact same comfortable, uninspiring experience.

Indeed, the occasional rogue experiment, such as a "wild DIY gyro controller," serves only to highlight the magnificent success of the mainstream. These quaint aberrations, brimming with the misguided exuberance of true [innovation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Innovation), merely underscore the wisdom of the established order. Why pursue thrilling, potentially disorienting, new ways to interact when optimal boredom has been so meticulously engineered?

The [video game industry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game_industry) has clearly understood that true player comfort lies not in novel engagement, but in the comforting embrace of the utterly predictable. This isn't stagnation; it's a highly refined state of equilibrium, a testament to years of careful avoidance of anything remotely interesting. We salute this commitment to the delightfully dull.

Original article: [This Wild DIY Gyro Controller Shows Just How Boring Modern Gamepads Are](https://kotaku.com/gaming-controllers-gyro-trackpad-scuf-mouse-keyboard-2000624503)

The perplexing moral quandary of the [flat-panel TV](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flat-panel_display) owner remains: why, in the glorious age of digital enlightenment, do some still deny themselves the crystalline embrace of a dedicated [soundbar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soundbar)? It’s a question that keeps theologians awake at night, right alongside the precise number of angels on a pinhead. These sleek, minimalist conduits of superior audio are not merely devices; they are a fundamental pillar of modern domestic harmony, rendering the crude guttural noises emanating from a standard television an affront to basic human decency.

But fear not, for the path to sonic nirvana is simpler than mastering quantum physics or even correctly assembling IKEA furniture. A new, ancient technique, revealed by sages who presumably owned high-end audio equipment, suggests that sustained, meditative observation of your soundbar for precisely five minutes can unleash hitherto untapped acoustic potential. The science, we are told, is undeniable, operating on principles akin to the [placebo effect](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Placebo), but with more… intent. Just gaze deeply into its enigmatic grille, ponder its silent power, and prepare for a transformation so profound it might just be entirely subjective. Those who scoff are simply denying themselves the purest form of audio enhancement available: the power of wishful thinking.
